title: France’s industrial strategy is bedevilled by blunders
text:
It has just lost its chief executive, while its former boss awaits trial in Tokyo. Its alliance with Nissan, on which it staked its future, is falling apart. And sales and profits are slumping, while its industry goes through a technological revolution.

It is hard to think of a major European company in more trouble right now than the car manufacturer Renault. With every week that passes, its problems look more terminal.

But hold on. That was also one of France’s biggest industrial strategy bets. And it is far from the only example. The Dutch and French governments have been taking larger and larger shares in Air France-KLM while the airline drifts nowhere, and the energy giant EDF, one of the...
description: It has just lost its chief executive, while its former boss awaits trial in Tokyo.
